doc.title: Inference API

application.doc: Azure OpenAI APIs for completions and search

doc.title: Creates a completion for the provided prompt, parameters and chosen model.

resource.doc: Creates a completion for the provided prompt, parameters and chosen model.

doc.title: Get a vector representation of a given input that can be easily consumed by machine learning models and algorithms.

resource.doc: Get a vector representation of a given input that can be easily consumed by machine learning models and algorithms.

param.name: deployment-id
param.doc: The deployment id of the model which was deployed.

doc.title: Creates a completion for the chat message

resource.doc: Creates a completion for the chat message

doc.title: Transcribes audio into the input language.

resource.doc: Transcribes audio into the input language.

param.name: file
param.doc: The audio file object to transcribe.

param.name: prompt
param.doc: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.

param.name: response_format
param.doc: AudioResponseFormat

param.name: temperature
param.doc: The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

param.name: language
param.doc: The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 format will improve accuracy and latency.

param.name: timestamp_granularities[]
param.doc: The timestamp granularities to populate for this transcription. `response_format` must be set `verbose_json` to use timestamp granularities. Either or both of these options are supported: `word`, or `segment`. Note: There is no additional latency for segment timestamps, but generating word timestamps incurs additional latency.

doc.title: Transcribes and translates input audio into English text.

resource.doc: Transcribes and translates input audio into English text.

param.name: file
param.doc: The audio file to translate.

param.name: prompt
param.doc: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should be in English.

param.name: response_format
param.doc: AudioResponseFormat

param.name: temperature
param.doc: The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.

doc.title: Generates audio from the input text.

resource.doc: Generates audio from the input text.

param.name: input
param.doc: The text to synthesize audio for. The maximum length is 4096 characters.

param.name: voice
param.doc: The voice to use for speech synthesis.

param.name: response_format
param.doc: The format to synthesize the audio in.

param.name: speed
param.doc: The speed of the synthesize audio. Select a value from `0.25` to `4.0`. `1.0` is the default.

doc.title: Generates a batch of images from a text caption on a given DALLE model deployment

resource.doc: Generates a batch of images from a text caption on a given DALLE model deployment

doc.title: Returns a list of assistants.

resource.doc: Returns a list of assistants.

param.name: limit
param.doc: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

param.name: order
param.doc: Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and `desc` for descending order.

param.name: after
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

param.name: before
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

doc.title: Create an assistant with a model and instructions.

resource.doc: Create an assistant with a model and instructions.

doc.title: Retrieves an assistant.

resource.doc: Retrieves an assistant.

param.name: assistant_id
param.doc: The ID of the assistant to retrieve.

doc.title: Modifies an assistant.

resource.doc: Modifies an assistant.

param.name: assistant_id
param.doc: The ID of the assistant to modify.

doc.title: Delete an assistant.

resource.doc: Delete an assistant.

param.name: assistant_id
param.doc: The ID of the assistant to delete.

param.doc: The ID of the thread to retrieve.

param.doc: The ID of the thread to modify. Only the `metadata` can be modified.

param.doc: The ID of the thread to delete.

doc.title: Returns a list of messages for a given thread.

resource.doc: Returns a list of messages for a given thread.

param.name: thread_id
param.doc: The ID of the [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) the messages belong to.

param.name: limit
param.doc: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

param.name: order
param.doc: Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and `desc` for descending order.

param.name: after
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

param.name: before
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

param.name: run_id
param.doc: Filter messages by the run ID that generated them.

param.doc: The ID of the [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) to create a message for.

param.name: message_id
param.doc: The ID of the message to modify.

doc.title: Create a thread and run it in one request.

resource.doc: Create a thread and run it in one request.

doc.title: Returns a list of runs belonging to a thread.

resource.doc: Returns a list of runs belonging to a thread.

param.name: thread_id
param.doc: The ID of the thread the run belongs to.

param.name: limit
param.doc: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

param.name: order
param.doc: Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and `desc` for descending order.

param.name: after
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

param.name: before
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

doc.title: Create a run.

resource.doc: Create a run.

param.name: thread_id
param.doc: The ID of the thread to run.

param.name: include[]
param.doc: A list of additional fields to include in the response. Currently the only supported value is `step_details.tool_calls[*].file_search.results[*].content` to fetch the file search result content.

doc.title: Retrieves a run.

resource.doc: Retrieves a run.

param.name: thread_id
param.doc: The ID of the [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) that was run.

param.name: run_id
param.doc: The ID of the run to retrieve.

doc.title: Modifies a run.

resource.doc: Modifies a run.

param.name: thread_id
param.doc: The ID of the [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) that was run.

param.name: run_id
param.doc: The ID of the run to modify.

doc.title: When a run has the `status: "requires_action"` and `required_action.

resource.doc: When a run has the `status: "requires_action"` and `required_action.type` is `submit_tool_outputs`, this endpoint can be used to submit the outputs from the tool calls once they're all completed. All outputs must be submitted in a single request.

param.name: thread_id
param.doc: The ID of the [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) to which this run belongs.

param.name: run_id
param.doc: The ID of the run that requires the tool output submission.

doc.title: Cancels a run that is `in_progress`.

resource.doc: Cancels a run that is `in_progress`.

param.name: thread_id
param.doc: The ID of the thread to which this run belongs.

param.name: run_id
param.doc: The ID of the run to cancel.

doc.title: Returns a list of run steps belonging to a run.

resource.doc: Returns a list of run steps belonging to a run.

param.name: thread_id
param.doc: The ID of the thread the run and run steps belong to.

param.name: run_id
param.doc: The ID of the run the run steps belong to.

param.name: limit
param.doc: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

param.name: order
param.doc: Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and `desc` for descending order.

param.name: after
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

param.name: before
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

param.name: include[]
param.doc: A list of additional fields to include in the response. Currently the only supported value is `step_details.tool_calls[*].file_search.results[*].content` to fetch the file search result content.

doc.title: Retrieves a run step.

resource.doc: Retrieves a run step.

param.name: thread_id
param.doc: The ID of the thread to which the run and run step belongs.

param.name: run_id
param.doc: The ID of the run to which the run step belongs.

param.name: step_id
param.doc: The ID of the run step to retrieve.

param.name: include[]
param.doc: A list of additional fields to include in the response. Currently the only supported value is `step_details.tool_calls[*].file_search.results[*].content` to fetch the file search result content.

param.name: before
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

doc.title: Returns a list of vector store files.

resource.doc: Returns a list of vector store files.

param.name: vector_store_id
param.doc: The ID of the vector store that the files belong to.

param.name: limit
param.doc: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

param.name: order
param.doc: Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and `desc` for descending order.

param.name: after
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

param.name: before
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

param.name: filter
param.doc: Filter by file status. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, `failed`, `cancelled`.

param.name: api-version
param.doc: api version

doc.title: Create a vector store file by attaching a File to a vector store.

resource.doc: Create a vector store file by attaching a [File](/docs/api-reference/files) to a [vector store](/docs/api-reference/vector-stores/object).

param.name: vector_store_id
param.doc: The ID of the vector store for which to create a File.

param.name: api-version
param.doc: api version

resource.doc: Retrieves a vector store file.

param.name: vector_store_id
param.doc: The ID of the vector store that the file belongs to.

param.name: file_id
param.doc: The ID of the file being retrieved.

param.name: api-version
param.doc: api version

doc.title: Delete a vector store file.

resource.doc: Delete a vector store file. This will remove the file from the vector store but the file itself will not be deleted. To delete the file, use the [delete file](/docs/api-reference/files/delete) endpoint.

param.name: vector_store_id
param.doc: The ID of the vector store that the file belongs to.

param.name: file_id
param.doc: The ID of the file to delete.

param.name: api-version
param.doc: api version

doc.title: Update attributes on a vector store file.

resource.doc: Update attributes on a vector store file.

param.name: vector_store_id
param.doc: The ID of the vector store the file belongs to.

param.name: file_id
param.doc: The ID of the file to update attributes.

doc.title: Retrieve the parsed contents of a vector store file.

resource.doc: Retrieve the parsed contents of a vector store file.

param.name: vector_store_id
param.doc: The ID of the vector store.

param.name: file_id
param.doc: The ID of the file within the vector store.

doc.title: Search a vector store for relevant chunks based on a query and file attributes filter.

resource.doc: Search a vector store for relevant chunks based on a query and file attributes filter.

param.name: vector_store_id
param.doc: The ID of the vector store to search.

param.name: batch_id
param.doc: The ID of the file batch being retrieved.

param.name: api-version
param.doc: api version

doc.title: Cancel a vector store file batch.

resource.doc: Cancel a vector store file batch. This attempts to cancel the processing of files in this batch as soon as possible.

param.name: vector_store_id
param.doc: The ID of the vector store that the file batch belongs to.

param.name: batch_id
param.doc: The ID of the file batch to cancel.

param.name: api-version
param.doc: api version

doc.title: Returns a list of vector store files in a batch.

resource.doc: Returns a list of vector store files in a batch.

param.name: vector_store_id
param.doc: The ID of the vector store that the files belong to.

param.name: batch_id
param.doc: The ID of the file batch that the files belong to.

param.name: limit
param.doc: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

param.name: order
param.doc: Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and `desc` for descending order.

param.name: after
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

param.name: before
param.doc: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

param.name: filter
param.doc: Filter by file status. One of `in_progress`, `completed`, `failed`, `cancelled`.

param.name: api-version
param.doc: api version

doc.title: Creates a model response.

resource.doc: Creates a model response. Provide [text](/docs/guides/text) or [image](/docs/guides/images) inputs to generate [text](/docs/guides/text) or [JSON](/docs/guides/structured-outputs) outputs. Have the model call your own [custom code](/docs/guides/function-calling) or use built-in [tools](/docs/guides/tools) like [web search](/docs/guides/tools-web-search) or [file search](/docs/guides/tools-file-search) to use your own data as input for the model's response.

doc.title: Retrieves a model response with the given ID.

resource.doc: Retrieves a model response with the given ID.

param.name: response_id
param.doc: The ID of the response to retrieve.

param.name: include
param.doc: Additional fields to include in the response. See the `include` parameter for Response creation above for more information.

doc.title: Deletes a model response with the given ID.

resource.doc: Deletes a model response with the given ID.

param.name: response_id
param.doc: The ID of the response to delete.

doc.title: Returns a list of input items for a given response.

resource.doc: Returns a list of input items for a given response.

param.name: response_id
param.doc: The ID of the response to retrieve input items for.

param.name: limit
param.doc: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

param.name: order
param.doc: The order to return the input items in. Default is `asc`. - `asc`: Return the input items in ascending order. - `desc`: Return the input items in descending order.

param.name: after
param.doc: An item ID to list items after, used in pagination.

param.name: before
param.doc: An item ID to list items before, used in pagination.
